entry.content:

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

The Input Channel Audit

entry.content:

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.content:

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.content:

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

entry.title: Genomic signature of Fanconi anaemia DNA repair pathway deficiency in cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Genomic signature of Fanconi anaemia DNA repair pathway deficiency in cancer

Defective DNA interstrand crosslink repair in Fanconi anaemia drives extensive genomic rearrangements, thereby substantially increasing the risk of cancer development.

  • Andrew L. H. Webster
  • Mathijs A. Sanders
  • Agata Smogorzewska
Article 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: A very luminous jet from the disruption of a star by a massive black hole (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A very luminous jet from the disruption of a star by a massive black hole

A series of early-time, multiwavelength observations of an optical transient, AT2022cmc, indicate that it is a relativistic jet from a tidal disruption event originating from a supermassive black hole.

  • Igor Andreoni
  • Michael W. Coughlin
  • Jielai Zhang
Article 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: Social trauma engages lateral septum circuitry to occlude social reward (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Social trauma engages lateral septum circuitry to occlude social reward

The authors show that, in a chronic social defeat stress rodent model, a subset of male and female mice avoided social interaction with non-aggressive, same-sex juvenile mice and did not develop context-dependent social reward following these encounters.

  • Long Li
  • Romain Durand-de Cuttoli
  • Scott J. Russo
Article Open Access 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: A photonic integrated continuous-travelling-wave parametric amplifier (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A photonic integrated continuous-travelling-wave parametric amplifier

By using Si3N4 photonic integrated circuits on a silicon chip, a continuous-travelling-wave parametric amplifier is shown to yield a parametric gain exceeding both on-chip propagation loss as well as fibre–chip–fibre coupling losses.

  • Johann Riemensberger
  • Nikolai Kuznetsov
  • Tobias J. Kippenberg
Article 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: PLD3 affects axonal spheroids and network defects in Alzheimer’s disease (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
PLD3 affects axonal spheroids and network defects in Alzheimer’s disease

Amyloid-plaque-associated axonal spheroids are prominent contributors to neural network dysfunction in an Alzheimer’s model and can be reversed by endolysosomal modulation.

  • Peng Yuan
  • Mengyang Zhang
  • Jaime Grutzendler
Article Open Access 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: Strong cloud–circulation coupling explains weak trade cumulus feedback (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Strong cloud–circulation coupling explains weak trade cumulus feedback

Analysis of new observations from the EUREC4A field campaign shows that lower-tropospheric mixing does not desiccate the base of trade cumulus clouds, refuting the mixing-desiccation hypothesis and explaining the weak trade cumulus feedback.

  • Raphaela Vogel
  • Anna Lea Albright
  • Sandrine Bony
Article Open Access 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: Human fetal cerebellar cell atlas informs medulloblastoma origin and oncogenesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Human fetal cerebellar cell atlas informs medulloblastoma origin and oncogenesis

Integrated single-cell atlases of human fetal cerebella and MBs show potential cell populations predisposed to transformation and regulatory circuitries underlying tumour cell states and oncogenesis, highlighting hitherto unrecognized transitional progenitor intermediates predictive of disease prognosis.

  • Zaili Luo
  • Mingyang Xia
  • Q. Richard Lu
Article 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: Ras drives malignancy through stem cell crosstalk with the microenvironment (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ras drives malignancy through stem cell crosstalk with the microenvironment

Aberrant crosstalk between cancer stem cells and their microenvironment triggers angiogenesis and TGFβ signalling, creating conditions that are conducive for hijacking leptin and leptin receptor signalling, which in turn launches downstream PI3K–AKT–mTOR signalling during the benign-to-malignant transition.

  • Shaopeng Yuan
  • Katherine S. Stewart
  • Elaine Fuchs
Article Open Access 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: Deglacial increase of seasonal temperature variability in the tropical ocean (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Deglacial increase of seasonal temperature variability in the tropical ocean

Mass spectrometry imaging of long-chain alkenones in sediments from the Cariaco Basin shows that average temperatures remained stable during the Younger Dryas to Holocene transition but seasonality more than doubled and interannual variability intensified.

  • Lars Wörmer
  • Jenny Wendt
  • Kai-Uwe Hinrichs
Article Open Access 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: Global hotspots of salt marsh change and carbon emissions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Global hotspots of salt marsh change and carbon emissions

Analysis of Landsat imagery from the past two decades allows quantification of the changes in salt marsh ecosystems, as well as associated carbon emissions resulting from net global losses.

  • Anthony D. Campbell
  • Lola Fatoyinbo
  • David Lagomasino
Article Open Access 30 Nov 2022

entry.title: A membrane-based seawater electrolyser for hydrogen generation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A membrane-based seawater electrolyser for hydrogen generation

An efficient and scalable direct seawater electrolysis method for hydrogen production that addresses the side-reaction and corrosion problems associated with using seawater instead of pure water is demonstrated.

  • Heping Xie
  • Zhiyu Zhao
  • Zongping Shao
Article 30 Nov 2022
